main event: Two spherical, orange objects were observed off the coast of Mayaguez, Puerto Rico on 14 May 1952.
interesting points: The two objects appeared to be revolving and changing positions and were sighted between 1900 and 1930 hrs,The observation lasted between 20 to 30 minutes,One object was stationary while the other darted around,Observers included a Puerto Rican businessman, a lawyer, an ex-Air Force pilot, a college student, and two other witnesses,Weather conditions were clear with excellent visibility at the time of the sighting.
witness description: A Puerto Rican businessman and lawyer, an ex-Air Force pilot, a Puerto Rican college student, and two other witnesses.
